Subject: migration of server to new platform
Description: We are closing a datacenter and need to migrate to another. The vmware infrastructure we are using will not be available in the new datacenter. Does endpointprotector support Nutanix? Another option we have is to move it to Azure. Is there a specific template we need to use for Azure? Can this run on a Windows server? If we deploy a new server, is the config migration as simple as creating a backup and then restoring that backup on the new server? Can we restore a linux config backup on a windows server?
What_We_Know__c:
4/10/2025

- Joined remote session with the customer
- V2 migration of EPP backup fails to upload to new EPP server
- Accessed backend and performed Procedure 17 to increase the nginx upload memory
- Customer able to upload file to new server
- Verified that computers, policies and users migrated successfully to new server
- Exited out of backend


4/9/2025

- Customer has received Azure VM yet when connecting to the web interface to access the EPP UI, he gets connection refused

- Scheduled remote session for 4/9/2025 at 11 AM CST to look further into the issue

- Customer has come back with an issue with uploading the V2 backup to new EPP server

- Sent request for available times on 4/10/2025 to perform the Changing maximum upload size of files on the EPP UI procedure

3/27/25

- Customer has requested the IP address to put in their ACL on the storage account
- Updated R&D ticket with customer's request


3/25/25

- Customer is currently reviewing these steps and mentioned that they are overly complicated
- Created Escalation Ticket 00439962
- Blob information located here: https://nwxcorp.sharepoint.com/sites/CustomerSupportFiles/Data/00439227


3/20/2025

- Customer has requested for an Azure EPP server image
- Verified EPP version is 5.9.4.1
- Azure ID is schemj@cpchem.com
Next_Steps__c: Customer has authorized to close case
